meanings.definition: A performer or act that is the main attraction in a show or event.
meanings.sent1: The headliner of the circus amazed the audience with their incredible tricks.
meanings.sent2: The headliner singer received a standing ovation at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The headliner clown made everyone laugh so hard they cried.
meanings.sent4: The headliner dancer lit up the stage with their graceful moves.
meanings.sent5: The headliner magician left everyone in awe with their mind-bending illusions.

meanings.definition: A headline or title at the top of a newspaper or magazine article.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper's headliner announced the breaking news to the readers.
meanings.sent2: The magazine's headliner story captured the attention of many.
meanings.sent3: The headliner headline made everyone stop in their tracks to read more.
meanings.sent4: The headliner title on the front page was bold and eye-catching.
meanings.sent5: The headliner article drew people in with its intriguing title.

meanings.definition: A panel or covering that is installed on the interior roof of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The car's headliner was made of soft fabric for a comfortable ride.
meanings.sent2: The headliner in the van was starting to sag and needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The headliner in the truck was so dirty, it looked like a starry night sky.
meanings.sent4: The headliner in the SUV provided insulation and reduced noise inside the vehicle.
meanings.sent5: The headliner material in the car added a touch of elegance to the interior.
